data.title: Best service in town
data.text:
I ordered the falafel, moussaka, and alexander.  The moussaka was the better of the three.  I will not be ordering the falafel again, as it was fried in an oil that was too hot, and it was not moist.

The best part of this restaurant is the service and the atmosphere.

data.title: A great place for Middle Eastern food
data.text: It's a Turkish restaurant, which means the cuisine is Turkish, but it offers a selection of Mediterranean cuisine. The menu is limited, but provides a nice selection. The quality of the food is distinctly above average. It has ambiance. It's in an old, upgraded building with high ceilings. Two levels. The building probably has a lot of history. Lots of space between the tables, so you don't feel crowded.

data.title: My favorite restaurant in Fayetteville
data.text: I love Sherefe.  From the friendly service and wine recommendations to the Mediterranean cuisine and delicious desserts, everything is always wonderful when I come here for lunch or dinner.  Their daily specials are always perfectly seasoned and simply delicious.  Even the salads are killer.  My favorite dessert so far is the creme brulee.

data.title: Sherefe
data.text: The food is good but dishes are repetitive. Vegetarian people like this restaurant very much. I went few times but after a while I got tired of the same taste.

data.title: Upscale and Fancy
data.text: I had the pleasure of dining at Sherefe, this past summer.  It was different,  or maybe I'm not use to fancy places. Lol.  First, we had to go upstairs, there were 8 of us and we were having our monthly/  plus anniversary meeting .   The staff were fantastic, and fun but kept it professional. ....The food, was soooo good.  You see I am a meat and potatoes, sweet tea drinking  and banana pudding type girl, so this was different  for me.  The food was really good, I had some type of soup that was light but hearty and filling, and my main course was good.  I took pictures so I will try and post.... If you want to impress, Sherefe is the place, of you want to have fun, and maybe add a cooking class, Sherefe is the one.  I promise you will not be disappointed.

data.title: A great afternoon lunch
data.text: Today was the first time we visited Sherefe's restaurant on Gillespie street in downtown Fayetteville, North Carolina. The restaurant has a great relaxing atmosphere to compliment it's great service and food, that comes along with it. Today our server was Kate, and she was very friendly and offered great suggestions on entrees and "Mezes" (appetizers).  We chose to eat the "Arancini Di Riso" as our appetizer (shown below) along with the "Special of the Day entree" which was a Smoked Salmon Canneloni. Both dishes were very delicious and filling. The restaurant itself offers dining inside and outside and has wifi available for customers. They also play very calming mood music which makes great for good conversation with your friends, family, or significant other. I highly recommend this place to eat if you are living or visiting the Fayetteville/Fort Bragg, Nc area.

data.title: Way overpriced for basic greek fare
data.text: As always a night in a strange new City I Look to TripAdvisor for restaurant as well as Hotel choices. Was in the market for some Greek food and looked up this restaurant on TripAdvisor. It was rated I believe 5th best out of three or four hundred  restaurants. We then looked up the menu on TripAdvisor and saw these fantastic prices and decided 2go for dinner. me my wife and my son. When we got there there restaurant menu was 30 to 50% higher than on TripAdvisor and one instance was double the price. we were already there and hungry so we ordered what would amount to about $30 worth of food at any of the Greek restaurants in Tarpon Springs Florida which is the area of where I live. The bill came to $109 with no alcohol (only water)and basically an appetizer a gyro, Greek meatballs and a lamb shank. Lamb was delicious gyro was avg and meatballs were extremely dry and didn't have much flavor. The restaurant had great ambiance and the waitress couldn't help enough but at the very least paid double what we should have for the amount and quality of food hopefully you have a better result. P.s. if you still want to go I would get on the phone with the restaurant and ask what the actual prices are as they are incorrect the menu with TripAdvisor

data.title: Delightful surprise
data.text: We are travelling and the restaurant we thought we wanted was not.  We had seen this restaurant in the app and as we left our first destination, it lead us here.  My husband thought it looked expensive, which it wasn't.  He ordered the soup of the day (lentil) and a salad. It was delicious and fresh.  I ordered the appetizer trio, which consisted of tobouli, hummous and stuffed grape leaves.  I didn't care for the hummous, as it had heat to it.  My husband loved it.  The others were wonderful.  When I come back, I will order the grape leaves entree.  Our lunches came to less than $30.00.

data.title: Lunch time
data.text: Rated high on trip advisor so I thought I'd give it a try. The service was fast and friendly. I ordered the lamb chops with basmati rice. The lamb was very tender and the tzatziki sauce on the side was a nice touch. I had a great experience overall and would defiantly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Vacation
data.text: Had dinner here tonight. Don't think waiter was to interested in us once we weren't ordering drinks or appetizers. Had house special veal scallopini. It was suppose to have a butter, lemon juice, capers and white wine sauce. It had no sauce, but the veal was tender. It also came with risotto it was very tasty, but was suppose to have spinach in it. Only saw 3 leaves. Also ordered Greek salad was great. All sides are extra $. Hubby had a daily special of sea bass. Was very tasty. Only cam with the fish and a side of small Greek salad.  My meal would have been 5 star if it came with what menu stated.

data.title: Excellent Mediterranean Food
data.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Fayetteville.  The food is excellent and fresh.  I took a very picky friend of mine there for her birthday and she had never had lamb.  The chef convinced her to give it a try and she loved it!  For lunch, try the roasted eggplant on pita with hummus topped with Greek salad.  Make sure you end the meal with their house blend coffee.  It's served in a French press and absolutely delicious.

data.title: My Favorite hidden gem by far!
data.text: The customers service is above and beyond and the food is some of the if not the best mediterranean food I have ever had!  The atmosphere is perfect for a date as a couple or family dinner.  If I could eat here every night I would!

data.title: Delicious authentic cuisine
data.text: The food was absolutely delicious. The patio is dog friendly as well. The staff was friendly and courteous. A great substitute for actually flying to the Mediterranean or Middle East.

data.title: Great food and my new favorite restaurant in downtown Fayetteville!
data.text: We had a great girls lunch at Sherefe's.  I loved that the menu had a wide enough selection to make everyone happy.  They were great in accommodating a gluten free diet.  Everyone was thrilled with their meal and we had a great time catching up in a relaxed environment.  The service was excellent!  Looking forward to my next visit.

owner_response.author: Food4thought2, Owner at Sherefe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Stephanie:
Thank you for taking time to share your experience!  I love that everything went well and that you and your friends had a great time!  We look forward to your next visit as well!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text:
My husband and I have been trying to come here for some time now as we absolutely love med food! The fact that they are closed on Sunday's has made it difficult as we have opposing schedules but it was worth the wait! We had the lamb stuffed filo pastry to start which was delicious and flakey with generous filling. 
For entrees my husband had the veal with lemon risotto and I had the kofte with quinoa. The veal was actually a little disappointing for my husband but I loved the buttery test. The kofte were perfect. I've eaten kofte in Turkey and l the taste was spot on! 
Next time we will order the feast meal to share. Service was wonderful too :-)

data.title: Good food, dinner was an event
data.text: Went to a bday party at Sherefe's in the upstairs room. Had a wonderful spread of appetizers served family style: hummus, grape leaves, kafta, pita bread, salad. The entrees were great too, it was a lot of food! The belly dancer was awesome!

data.title: Great Downtown Dining
data.text: This is a great downtown establishment.  The food is good and the service is too.  If you're looking for something different, give a try.  You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Lunch with friends
data.text: Sherefe always delivers great food and great service! As a downtown employee a quick lunch is key as I have many meetings and walk in clients. Their servers value their customers time and any time I call in a Togo order it's ready as soon as I walk in! Thanks Sherefe!

owner_response.author: Food4thought2, Owner at Sherefe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking time to share you experience.  We sooo love our lunch buddies!  Have a great day and can't wait to see you next time.

Mustafa
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food!
data.text: I have been There a couple times and the food has been great!  They serve a delicious lemon chicken soup.  Service is great!

data.title: For a great time
data.text: Went to a Mediterranean cooking class about 20 people or so what a great meal and great time was totally worth it will go again
